channel.title: Lunar Altar. [help me]
channel.description: Hey guys, I have a lunar altar in Edgeville, not sure what the objects codes are but is there anyway I can move it to a different place? (I don't want to get rid of it). (317, Delta) Thanks.

item.title: Lunar Altar. [help me]
item.dc:creator: @Original-Gaming Original-Gaming
item.description:
@Original-Gaming wrote:

^ This Is Me Giving More Information On That Post Above,

Go Into Client.Java(client class)

Hit Ctrl + f and type Paste This In There “public void makeGlobalObject” And Click Enter

Then Hit Ctrl + f Again And Look For “410” You Should See Something Like This

“makeGlobalObject(####, ####, 410, -1, 10);” (The #### = Coords So Type ::mypos Or ::coords And Put Them In)

Then Leave The 410 And The -1 Is How It’s Facing But Given The Fact That The Lunar Altar Is Almost A Circle it Doesn’t Matter. Hope This Helped.

Read full topic

item.title: Lunar Altar. [help me]
item.dc:creator: @stefano1911 stefano1911
item.description:
@stefano1911 wrote:

sure go to client.java and search for itemid: 409 or 410 or 411 not sure

and go to the place u want the altar to be and do ::mypos copy that coords to the client.java file

its 00,1/10 easy there are like 1000 tutorials about it next time use the search buttonpm me if u need more help

Read full topic

item.title: Lunar Altar. [help me]
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

yes you can , i recommend using project fubergen to see the id , when you right click and object , item or npc , it says the id!
goodluck!
if you dont wanna download projectfubergen pm me i have Projetf and i can tell you the id
